name: Goodman and Kruskal's Gamma
description: Goodman-Kruskal $\\gamma$ is a measure of rank correlation between x and y and is given by $(n_c -n_d) / (n_c + n_d)$, where $n_c$ is the number of concordant pairs of the observations and $n_d$ is the number of discordant pairs.
x_kb_article:
## References
1. Wolfram Research. (2012). GoodmanKruskalGamma. Wolfram Language function.  [Link](https://reference.wolfram.com/language/ref/GoodmanKruskalGamma.html)
